p: Patients with mild disease presented with dry cough, fever, sore throat, with or without nasal congestion, generalized body ache, headache, and fatigue. In severe form, the symptoms were tachypnea and dyspnea. In critical cases, patients complained of respiratory failure (severe dyspnea, respiratory distress >30/min, tachypnea and hypoxia), fever, decreased blood oxygen saturation of less than or equal to 93%, lung filtrates, shock, and multiple organ dysfunctions or even failure [ 2, 14]. Research also showed that in severe conditions, patients showed signs of weakened breath sound, moist rales, dull percussion, and a decrease in tactile speech tremor [ 6]. The disease causes not only respiratory symptoms but also gastrointestinal symptoms such as diarrhea [ 15]. Laboratory complete blood count tests may show normal or reduced white blood cell count or reduced lymphocyte count in the early stages of the disease onset [ 6, 15]. Patients also show elevated C-reactive protein levels [ 16].
